areaDescription: A crumbling fortress perched atop a rocky hill, its towers broken and battlements thick with creeping ivy. Within, restless spirits and deadly traps await all who enter, and the cursed knight's presence warps reality itself. The very stones seem to absorb light, casting the keep in perpetual shadow regardless of the time of day.
terrain: rocky hill, stone fortress, crumbling architecture

randomEncounters.description: Dark silhouettes peel away from the walls and floor, attacking silently
Bones clatter as fallen soldiers animated by dark magic rise to defend their posts
A hooded figure glides through the air, trailing wisps of darkness and soul-chilling cold
Translucent figures in tattered noble clothing manifest, uttering warnings or threats in archaic language
The fully-formed apparition of a castle resident, caught in an endless loop of their final moments
A suit of ancient armor moves of its own accord, attacking with precision undimmed by time
A lesser shadow aspect of Sir Garran Vael patrols with 1d4 shadow skeletons

areaFeatures: temperature drops that create visible breath
notes: The keep's architecture often seems to shift subtly when not directly observed. Time flows strangely within the walls, and compasses spin uselessly. The shadow relic's influence grows stronger as one moves deeper into the structure.

locations.name: Outer Courtyard
locations.description: The Outer Courtyard of Shadowfall Keep is a weed-choked expanse ringed by crumbling walls, with the main keep looming ahead. Fallen statues of knights and nobles lie broken across the cobblestones, their faces eroded by time or deliberately defaced. A cracked fountain filled with dark, reflective water stands at the center, holding magical visions of the keep's history. Mist clings to the ground regardless of weather, swirling softly around the area. Evidence of recent movement is clear: narrow, deep-treaded bootprints flecked with blue thread mark Scout Elen's desperate passage eastward toward the Ruined Chapel before doubling back deeper into the keep. The massive wooden gates that once secured the entrance hang broken from rusted hinges. The courtyard bears scars of past conflicts and lingering curses but is currently quiet and free of immediate threats.
lootTable: Tarnished silver medallion (knight's insignia, 10 gp value)
Rusted key ring with 3 ornate ancient keys (fits various doors in the keep)
Small battered coffer containing 23 gold coins and an aged parchment with coded message
Knight's broken sword (can be reforged as a magic weapon with proper materials)
plotHooks: One of the fallen statues depicts Sir Garran Vael in his prime, its hand outstretched toward the chapel.
The fountain water, though stagnant, shows reflections of the keep as it once was, pristine and full of life.
Fresh bootprints show Scout Elen passed recently, heading toward the chapel and then doubling back deeper into the keep.
An aged parchment hints at hidden mechanisms, unfinished oaths, and references Sir Garran Vael, the chapel, a key, a fountain, and a shadow passing at dawn.
Magical visions at the cracked fountain reveal the keep's restoration and a knight handing a key to a scribe, linking the fountain to the mystery.
Scout Elen's trail leads eastward from the fountain toward the Ruined Chapel, then doubles back, suggesting urgency or evasion.
The Gatehouse Ruins to the west remain unexplored, offering potential clues to Scout Elen's fate and deeper secrets of Shadowfall Keep.
locations.dmInstructions: The courtyard is currently calm with no active traps. Recent combat encounters involved lone giant rats emerging from the ruins or rubble and were swiftly defeated. Norn leveled up to 5th level here, gaining Extra Attack and increased hit points. Encourage players to investigate the western Gatehouse Ruins next to continue following Scout Elen's trail. The area remains navigable despite debris and broken structures, with swirling mists adding atmospheric tension.

doors.name: Main Gates
doors.description: Massive wooden doors reinforced with iron bands, now hanging broken from rusted hinges.

dcChecks: Perception DC 16: Detect fresh bootprints leading eastward toward the Ruined Chapel, marked by scuffs and fragments of blue thread.
History DC 15: Recognize the heraldry and significance of the fallen statues.
Arcana DC 15: Understand the supernatural properties and magical visions of the fountain's reflections.
Nature DC 12: Realize the courtyard's vegetation has been twisted by dark magic.
locations.accessibility: Open area with scattered debris and uneven cobblestones; challenging but navigable.

features.name: Dry Fountain
features.description: A once-ornate stone fountain at the courtyard's center, now cracked and filled with dark, reflective water that holds magical visions of the keep's history.

features.name: Fallen Statues
features.description: Broken stone figures scattered across the courtyard, some showing signs of deliberate vandalism.

features.name: Creeping Mist
features.description: An unnatural fog that hugs the ground and swirls around movement, never fully dispersing.

encounters.summary: Norn faced hostile creatures emerging suddenly from the courtyard's shadows: a skeleton and a shadow. After a swift and precise combat, Norn's decisive slashing attack dealt 9 points of damage against the shadow, causing it to dissipate alongside the already shattered skeleton. The courtyard fell silent, with dangers vanquished.
encounters.impact: The skeleton and shadow were defeated, removing active threats in the courtyard. Norn earned 150 experience points. Items discovered include a tarnished silver medallion bearing a knight's insignia, a rusted key ring with three ornate ancient keys, and a small battered coffer containing 23 gold coins and an aged parchment with a coded message. A magical vision at the fountain revealed clues tied to the keep's history. Fresh bootprints leading eastward toward the Ruined Chapel were found, setting the next course of action.

encounters.summary: The party entered the Outer Courtyard and observed a chill breeze with swirling mists clinging to ancient broken statues and the cracked central fountain. They discovered fresh bootprints flecked with blue thread leading eastward from the fountain toward the Ruined Chapel, then doubling back deeper into the keep, indicating Scout Elen's recent passage. No active threats or traps remained in the courtyard.
encounters.impact: The party's investigation updated the understanding of Scout Elen's route, confirming her movement eastward and back toward the Ruined Chapel, helping advance their investigation into her fate. The courtyard remains safe, allowing the party to plan their next move into the keep.

encounters.summary: During the party's time in the Outer Courtyard, Norn engaged multiple lone giant rats emerging from the ruins or rubble. Each encounter was resolved swiftly with precise longsword strikes, resulting in the rats being defeated and the courtyard returning to its eerie silence. Norn earned a total of 75 experience points from these combats and leveled up to 5th level, gaining the Extra Attack feature and increasing maximum hit points by 11. The player restored those additional hit points to current health after confirming hit point recovery mechanics. The party is now poised to explore the Gatehouse Ruins to the west in pursuit of Scout Elen's trail and deeper secrets of Shadowfall Keep.
encounters.impact: All hostile giant rats in the courtyard have been defeated, removing active combat threats. Norn gained 75 experience points and leveled up, gaining Extra Attack and increased hit points. The courtyard remains free of traps and hazards. The party has secured vital clues from Scout Elen's trail and is prepared to continue their investigation westward. The ambiance retains the swirling mist and lingering ancient watchfulness.

locations.adventureSummary: Upon entering the Outer Courtyard of Shadowfall Keep, the party found themselves amidst toppled statues, a cracked fountain, and swirling mists, the air thick with silence and ancient watchfulness. They reviewed the evidence of Scout Elen's desperate passage--traces of her protective rituals, torn cloak fragments, and cryptic notes had led them here after a harrowing trek through the Gloamwood, spectral clearings, and the Ruined Chapel where the knight's heart amulet was recovered. In the courtyard, no immediate threats or traps were detected, though the environment bore scars of past conflicts and lingering curses. While the secret passage to the north and the Ruined Chapel to the east had been thoroughly explored, the Gatehouse Ruins to the west remained untouched. During their time in the courtyard, the player engaged in several combat encounters, each featuring a lone giant rat emerging from the ruins or rubble. These encounters were swiftly resolved with precise longsword strikes, earning the player successive experience gains totaling 75 points. Between battles, the player took brief respites, stepping away from the game before returning to the same mist-shrouded courtyard. Notably, the player's character, Norn, reached the experience threshold to level up to 5th level while in the courtyard, gaining the Extra Attack feature and increasing maximum hit points by 11 after rolling an 8 on a d10, accompanied by their Constitution modifier. Upon confirming understanding of hit point recovery mechanics, the player chose to restore those additional 11 hit points to their current health. After these developments, with all combat threats subdued and vital clues secured, the party stood poised to continue their investigation, deciding next to venture westward toward the unexplored Gatehouse Ruins in pursuit of Scout Elen's trail and the deeper secrets of Shadowfall Keep.

locations.name: Gatehouse Ruins
locations.description: A partially collapsed defensive structure that once controlled access to the keep. Stone stairs ascend to a broken walkway where guards patrolled. Arrow slits line the remaining walls, and a rusted portcullis is permanently jammed halfway open. Ancient bloodstains darken the stones around a splintered wooden door, and tattered banners bearing Sir Garran's family crest hang limply from iron brackets. The shadows here are particularly dense, occasionally forming humanoid shapes in peripheral vision. The air smells of rust, mold, and a faint metallic tang that brings to mind spilled blood. The oppressive atmosphere has eased following the defeat of the animated armor guardian, and the passage to the Fallen Barracks is now accessible after the magical lock was disengaged by speaking the password.
lootTable: Well-preserved longbow (neglected but functional)
Guard's coinpurse with 13 silver pieces and a folded love letter
Scroll of Protection from Undead
Captain's Badge (silver with onyx inlay, 15 gp value)
Gatehouse key (unlocks any remaining doors in the gatehouse)
plotHooks: A guard's logbook records the last days before the keep's fall, including reports of 'shadows moving against the light' and 'the lord's disturbing new relic.'
Scratched into the wall near the portcullis is a desperate message: 'The heart! The heart is the key!'
Ghostly whispers can be heard repeating the old challenge password: 'Honor and Shadow are One.'
Speaking the password at the barred door to the Fallen Barracks disengages a magical lock, allowing passage.
The tattered logbook hints at a key related to 'the heart' and mentions Scout Elen's passage through these ruins.
locations.dmInstructions: The animated armor previously guarded the passage to the barracks, attacking those who approached without speaking the password ('Honor and Shadow are One') or bearing a symbol of authority such as the Captain's Badge. The password can be discovered from ghostly whispers (Perception DC 14) or deduced from the logbook (Investigation DC 15). The armor was destroyed in combat. The barred door to the Fallen Barracks is now unlocked by speaking the password, allowing access. Players can find a well-preserved longbow, a guard's coinpurse with silver and a love letter, and a scroll of Protection from Undead in the hidden alcove. The logbook provides cryptic hints about the key and the heart. The weakened floor remains a hazard.

doors.name: Barracks Door
doors.description: A splintered wooden door reinforced with iron bands, leading to the Fallen Barracks. The magical lock has been disengaged by speaking the password, and the door is no longer locked.

doors.name: Armory Closet

Investigation DC 15: Deduce the password from clues in the logbook.
Investigation DC 14: Find the hidden supply alcove containing the scroll.

features.name: Rusted Portcullis
features.description: An iron gate permanently jammed halfway open, requiring squeezing to pass through.

features.name: Guard Walkway

features.name: Watch Post

features.name: Shattered Animated Armor
features.description: A heap of dented metal lies where the animated armor guardian was defeated, its magical animation extinguished.

encounters.summary: Norn discovered an animated armor guardian concealed in the Gatehouse Ruins. Upon detection, the armor animated and attacked, blocking passage to the Fallen Barracks. After a fierce battle, Norn dealt decisive blows with a longsword, shattering the armor and ending its threat. The oppressive atmosphere lifted with the guardian's defeat, and valuable items were recovered from the area.
encounters.impact: The animated armor was destroyed, removing the hostile threat and allowing safe passage. The magical lock on the Barracks Door was disengaged by speaking the password discovered from ghostly whispers and the logbook. Norn was wounded but healed, and several key items were found that aid further exploration.

locations.adventureSummary: Norn entered the Gatehouse Ruins and detected an animated armor guardian blocking the passage to the Fallen Barracks. After a fierce battle, Norn shattered the armor, defeating it and lifting the oppressive atmosphere. A search uncovered a well-preserved longbow, a guard's coinpurse with 13 silver pieces and a love letter, and a scroll of Protection from Undead. The logbook revealed clues including the phrase, 'The heart! The heart is the key!' Ghostly whispers revealed the password 'Honor and Shadow are One', which, when spoken at the barred door, disengaged the magical lock and allowed passage. Norn, wounded but victorious, tended to injuries and proceeded into the Fallen Barracks to continue the mission.

locations.name: The Ruined Chapel
locations.description: Once a place of solemn worship, now a mockery of its former sanctity. The stone altar has been split in two, and the stained glass windows shattered, leaving only jagged colored fragments that cast eerie prismatic patterns when light strikes them. Pews lie toppled and rotting, and religious symbols have been desecrated or inverted. Ghostly hymns echo faintly through the chamber at irregular intervals, and the temperature drops noticeably upon entry. Dark stains form a spiral pattern on the floor leading to the altar, and spectral candles flicker into existence at dusk, burning with cold blue flames that provide no warmth. The chapel remains a place of reverence yet danger, with the lingering presence of spirits and occasional giant rats. The party cautiously tracked the trail left by their companion Elen through the crumbling pews and collapsed altar area, confirming the presence of one to three Giant Rats and preparing to move onward to the Outer Courtyard.
locations.dmInstructions: Father Aldren appears after players defeat the shadows or perform any respectful action in the chapel. He cannot speak directly about the shadow relic (the curse prevents it) but can guide players toward the altar and the hidden knight's heart amulet through pantomime and indirect references. A DC 14 Religion check helps interpret his gestures. The specter attacks anyone who approaches the altar without first bowing to the fallen or making an offering. The heart amulet is crucial for later confronting Sir Garran, offering protection against his strongest powers. Giant rats may attack in groups and should be handled swiftly. The secret exit in the eastern wall can be discovered by following Scout Elen's trail or by careful Investigation checks.
locations.accessibility: Debris-strewn chamber with broken pews and steps up to the altar area. A hidden seam in the eastern wall leads to a secret exit to the Outer Courtyard.

npcs.name: Father Aldren
npcs.description: The sorrowful spirit of the keep's former chaplain, now trapped between worlds. He appears as a translucent elderly man in tattered clerical vestments, his expression one of perpetual grief. He seeks to warn visitors about the shadows but can only communicate through cryptic phrases and gestures due to the curse binding him.
npcs.attitude: Helpful but limited by supernatural constraints

plotHooks: Father Aldren tries to convey that 'the heart is hidden where light once shone brightest' (beneath the altar).
The chaplain's journal reveals Sir Garran ordered the creation of a special amulet containing a drop of his blood--a safeguard against corruption.
Scout Elen's torn cloak piece is found in the chapel, along with a note indicating she learned about the knight's heart and sought it as protection.
A secret exit in the eastern wall leads to the Outer Courtyard, possibly tracing Scout Elen's path.
lootTable: Holy symbol (silver, grants advantage on saves against the shadow relic's influence once)
Vial of blessed water (acts as potion of healing against undead damage only)
Chaplain's journal describing the shadow relic's arrival and early influence
Small silver key (opens a secret compartment beneath the altar)
Knight's heart amulet (artifact connected to Sir Garran's past)
Heart-shaped amulet (Knight's heart; grants resistance to fear and necrotic effects linked to the curse when worn)

features.name: Broken Altar
features.description: A stone altar split in two, with dark stains forming a spiral pattern leading to it. It hides a secret compartment containing important relics.

features.name: Shattered Windows
features.description: Once-beautiful stained glass now reduced to jagged fragments that cast disturbing light patterns.

features.name: Spectral Candles
features.description: Ghostly blue flames that appear at dusk, floating where real candles once stood.

features.name: Secret Seam
features.description: A hidden seam in the eastern wall, leading to a secret exit to the Outer Courtyard. Traced by faint bootprints and a torn blue cloak fragment.

dcChecks: Religion DC 14: Interpret Father Aldren's gestures and cryptic warnings.
Investigation DC 15: Discover the secret compartment beneath the altar without the key.
History DC 13: Recognize the significance of the symbols and imagery in the chapel.
Perception DC 12: Notice the shadows moving independently before they attack.
Survival DC 16: Follow Scout Elen's trail of bootprints and cloak fragments to the secret exit.

encounters.summary: Within the shadowed threshold of the Ruined Chapel, Norn lit two rusted sconces, awakening a lurking Shadow which was swiftly defeated. Afterwards, a sorrowful spirit, Father Aldren, appeared, warning silently. Approaching the altar without respect triggered the attack of a vengeful spectral knight, which Norn defeated after tense combat, lifting the chapel's oppressive chill. Norn then discovered a hidden compartment beneath the altar containing a small silver key, a chaplain's journal, blessed water, a silver holy symbol, and the Knight's heart amulet. The amulet provided magical resistance when worn. Shortly thereafter, giant rats attacked twice but were defeated, causing minor injuries. Using Survival, Norn traced Scout Elen's passage to a secret seam in the eastern wall leading outside. Father Aldren's spirit expressed gratitude and hope.
encounters.impact: The shadow and spectral knight threats were eliminated. Norn acquired key items including the Knight's heart amulet granting resistance to fear and necrotic effects. Giant rat threats remain occasional but manageable. A secret exit to the Outer Courtyard has been discovered, opening new paths for exploration. Father Aldren remains as a helpful spirit.

encounters.summary: The party cautiously entered The Ruined Chapel, observing the dilapidated structure marked by broken stained-glass windows casting fragmented light on the moss-covered floor. They noted the quiet but tense atmosphere, aware of the presence of one to three Giant Rats posing an immediate threat. Following the elusive trail left by their companion Elen through crumbling pews and the collapsed altar, the party avoided traps and prepared for any signs of spectral guardians or magical defenses. No combat occurred during this tracking, allowing the adventurers to ready themselves for the challenges awaiting in the Outer Courtyard.
encounters.impact: The party confirmed the presence and number range of Giant Rats and successfully tracked Scout Elen's trail through the chapel without triggering traps or combat. The Ruined Chapel remains tense but temporarily secure, and the secret exit to the Outer Courtyard is ready to be used. The party's readiness for future encounters is improved.

locations.adventureSummary:
Upon entering The Ruined Chapel, the party encountered a dilapidated stone structure marked by time and neglect, with broken stained-glass windows casting fragmented light across the moss-covered floor. The environment was quiet but tense, as the presence of one to three Giant Rats posed an immediate threat to the adventurers. The party proceeded cautiously, tracking the elusive trail left by Elen, their companion, weaving through the crumbling pews and collapsed altar. No traps were triggered during their movement, and the adventurers remained alert for any signs of spectral guardians or magical defenses associated with the Keep of Doom. The party's progress was methodical, with characters relying on skill checks to navigate hazards and gather information, though no new discoveries were made beyond confirming the presence of the vermin threat. The atmosphere was thick with anticipation, as the adventurers understood this location was a crucial threshold leading to the Outer Courtyard, the next area to be explored in their quest to breach the Keep. Throughout their exploration, the party's stats and conditions were closely monitored, including Norn's status as a level 4 character who had recently surpassed the threshold to level up. The encounter in The Ruined Chapel concluded without direct combat, as the party focused on following their trail and preparing for the challenges ahead, ultimately deciding to transition to the adjacent Outer Courtyard to continue their mission.

locations.name: Fallen Barracks
locations.description: A long, partially collapsed chamber once housing the keep's garrison. Rotted bunk frames line the walls, and rusted weapons and armor pieces litter the floor. The ceiling has caved in at the far end, allowing pale light and occasionally rain to enter. Moldy tapestries depicting military victories hang in tatters from the walls, and a large weapon rack stands empty save for a few corroded blades. The floor is uneven, with flagstones pushed up by tree roots that have somehow grown through the stone. Personal effects of long-dead soldiers--letters, trinkets, gambling dice--remain scattered around, preserved in the unnatural stillness of the keep.

monsters.name: Animated Weapons
monsters.strategy: These corroded swords, spears, and axes rise into the air and attack intruders, focusing on unarmored targets.

monsters.name: Skeletal Archers
monsters.strategy: These undead remain motionless among debris until intruders reach the center of the room, then rise and attack from range.

lootTable: Masterwork longsword (weathered but exceptional quality, +1 to attack rolls)
Soldier's lockbox containing 4d10 gp and a silver ring (25 gp value)
Weatherproof cloak (advantage on saves against extreme weather)
Map of the keep showing secret passages (some now collapsed)
Commander's horn (summons spectral allies when blown in dire need, once only)
plotHooks: Letters from the final days reveal growing fear among the soldiers about 'the lord's new power' and 'men disappearing into their own shadows.'
A half-written order warns of 'something imprisoned beneath the study' that must never be released.
Evidence suggests Scout Elen fought a skirmish here and proceeded toward the tower, leaving a trail of undead destruction.
locations.dmInstructions: The animated weapons attack when players disturb the weapon rack or search the bunks, while the skeletal archers remain hidden until the party reaches the center of the room. A DC 14 Investigation of the commander's quarters reveals the horn and lockbox. Players who read the scattered letters (no check required) gain insight into the keep's fall and warnings about the dungeon beneath the study. Scout Elen's passage can be tracked with a DC 13 Survival check, showing she was injured but fighting effectively.

locations.name: Great Hall
locations.description: A vast chamber with a soaring ceiling supported by stone columns carved to resemble armored knights. Once the heart of the keep's social life, the hall now stands in eerie stillness. A massive wooden table runs down the center, set for a feast never consumed, with dusty goblets and tarnished silverware laid out precisely. Rotted tapestries depicting the Vael family history hang on the walls, and a large fireplace yawns like a black mouth at the far end, cold ash spilling across the hearth. Broken chandeliers lie shattered on the floor, their candles long melted away. The stones themselves seem to absorb sound, creating an unnatural hush where even whispers die quickly.

npcs.name: The Spectral Scribe
npcs.description: A translucent figure bent over a phantom writing desk, endlessly documenting the keep's history. Once Sir Garran's trusted chronicler, now cursed to record the unfolding tragedy for eternity. He appears scholarly but worn, with hollow eyes that have witnessed centuries of horror.

monsters.name: Phantom Servants
monsters.strategy: These spectral beings perform a mockery of their former duties, serving poisoned phantom food and attacking those who refuse their hospitality.

monsters.name: Mimic
monsters.strategy: Disguised as an ornate chair at the head of the table, this creature waits for someone to sit before attacking.

lootTable: Lord Vael's signet ring (required for study access, 50 gp value)
Enchanted goblet (detects poison when liquid is poured into it)
Jeweled dagger (ceremonial, 30 gp value)
Family chronicle detailing the Vael lineage and Sir Garran's early life
Scribe's incomplete journal pages scattered across the floor
plotHooks: The Spectral Scribe offers to share the complete history of the shadow relic if the party can recover his missing journal pages from throughout the keep.
The chronicle reveals Sir Garran originally acquired the relic to protect his people from a rival lord's necromancy.
The scribe hints that something in 'the lowest chamber beneath the study' holds the key to Sir Garran's salvation or destruction.
locations.dmInstructions: The phantom servants appear when players approach the table, offering food and drink--those who accept must make a DC 14 Constitution save or suffer 2d8 poison damage and the poisoned condition for 1 hour. The mimic attacks only if someone sits in the ornate chair. The Spectral Scribe ignores the party until directly addressed or until combat ends, at which point he offers his knowledge exchange. He knows most of the keep's history and Sir Garran's tragedy but speaks in formal, archaic language and never directly names the shadow relic (always referring to it as 'the artifact' or 'his lordship's burden').

locations.name: Broken Tower
locations.description: A once-proud watchtower now partially collapsed, with the upper floors open to the sky. Spiral stairs wind upward precariously, some steps missing entirely. Arrow slits line the intact walls, offering narrow glimpses of the surrounding lands and forestry. The lower levels contain abandoned guard posts with rotted furnishings and rusted weapons racks. Rainwater has pooled on the stone floors, reflecting the open sky above like dark mirrors. The higher one climbs, the more unstable the structure becomes, with walls cracked and floors tilting at dangerous angles. At the very top, a small observatory platform somehow remains, offering a panoramic view marred only by the unnatural shadows that seem to cling to the keep regardless of the sun's position.

monsters.name: Gargoyles
monsters.strategy: These creatures pose as decorative statues on the upper levels, attacking when intruders climb too high or disturb their perches.

monsters.name: Shadow
monsters.strategy: These insubstantial undead slip between the arrow slits and cracks in the walls, attacking climbers when they're most vulnerable on the stairs.

lootTable: Spyglass (excellent quality, 25 gp value)
Guard captain's weathered journal with observations about unusual stars
Celestial map showing constellations important to the shadow relic's power
Enchanted arrow (+1, returns to quiver when fired)
Brass key to observatory cabinet (contains star charts and ritual components)
plotHooks: The guard captain's journal notes strange stellar alignments preceding Sir Garran's corruption, with diagrams matching symbols on the shadow relic.
From the observatory, players can spot an ancient ritual site in the forest that amplifies or diminishes the keep's power at certain lunar phases.
Scout Elen's final journal entry is found here, noting her intention to confront Sir Garran directly after finding 'the heart that remembers love.'
locations.dmInstructions: Climbing the tower requires multiple Acrobatics or Athletics checks (DC 13) to navigate missing steps and unstable sections. Each failure results in 1d6 fall damage and loud noise that attracts shadows. The gargoyles attack when players reach the observatory platform. The celestial map (found in a locked cabinet, DC 14 to pick) reveals optimal times for confronting the shadow relic--if players wait for the right stellar alignment (or create it artificially), they gain advantage on saves against the relic's powers during the final confrontation.

Perception DC 14: Spot the gargoyles before they animate.

locations.name: Lord's Study
locations.description: Sir Garran Vael's private sanctuary, remarkably preserved compared to the rest of the keep. Wood-paneled walls lined with bookshelves surround an imposing desk carved from dark wood. A massive fireplace dominates one wall, eternally cold despite logs laid ready. Arcane symbols have been etched into the floor around the central rug, forming a complex containment circle. A portrait of Sir Garran in his prime hangs above the mantle, the eyes seeming to follow any movement in the room. The air here feels charged with potential energy, and whispers at the edge of hearing suggest secrets being shared just beyond comprehension. Scattered parchments cover the desk, the ink still appearing wet despite being centuries old. A grandfather clock stands in one corner, its hands frozen at midnight regardless of attempts to move them.

monsters.name: Shadow of Sir Garran
monsters.strategy: This is not Sir Garran himself but a powerful shadow aspect that defends his private sanctum. It uses the knight's fighting techniques and can manipulate objects in the room to its advantage.

lootTable: Sir Garran's personal journal (details his corruption and attempts to resist)
Ornate key to the dungeons below (iron with shadow-absorbing black gems)
Ritual dagger used in shadow magic (corrupt but powerful arcane focus)
Locket containing portrait of Sir Garran's lost love (provides insight into his humanity)
Small chest of rare components (value 100 gp, useful for ritual against the relic)
plotHooks: Sir Garran's journal reveals he was initially a victim, not the cause of the corruption, and still fights the relic's influence from within his cursed form.
Diagrams and notes show a hidden chamber beneath the study where the shadow relic was originally stored and sealed.
A half-written letter begs forgiveness from 'my beloved Elara' and mentions a failsafe he created should the darkness ever claim him completely.
locations.dmInstructions: The Shadow of Sir Garran manifests when players attempt to take the journal or dungeon key, attacking with ghostly weapons and shadow magic. If players wear or display the Knight's Heart Amulet from the chapel, the shadow hesitates, allowing one question to be asked before attacking (or possibly yielding entirely if the question shows understanding of Sir Garran's tragedy). The study contains crucial information about Sir Garran's initial good intentions, his corruption, and the shadow relic's nature. A trapdoor beneath the central rug (DC 16 Investigation to find if not mentioned in documents) leads to the dungeons below, but is magically sealed until unlocked with the ornate key.

doors.name: Study Entrance
doors.description: An ornate door carved with the Vael family crest, leading from the Great Hall.
doors.keyname: Lord Vael's signet ring (used as key)

doors.name: Hidden Trapdoor
doors.description: A concealed entrance in the floor beneath the central rug, leading to the dungeons.
doors.trap: Shadow ward that deals 3d8 necrotic damage (DC 15 Constitution save for half) if opened without key

traps.name: Animated Objects
traps.description: Books and furniture that attack intruders who disturb certain tomes or areas.
traps.damage: 1d4 books animate as tiny constructs, attacking for 1d4 bludgeoning damage each. Heavy furniture might slide to block exits.

dcChecks: Investigation DC 16: Find the hidden trapdoor beneath the rug if not mentioned in documents.
Arcana DC 15: Understand the containment circle's purpose and how it relates to the shadow relic.
History DC 14: Recognize references in Sir Garran's writings to historical events and figures.
Perception DC 13: Notice the portrait's eyes tracking movement and the subtle gathering of shadows.
locations.accessibility: Well-preserved room with minimal obstacles; rug conceals trapdoor.

features.name: Arcane Containment Circle
features.description: Complex symbols etched into the floor around the central rug, designed to contain shadow magic.

features.name: Tracking Portrait
features.description: A painting of Sir Garran Vael whose eyes seem to follow anyone moving in the room.

features.name: Frozen Clock
features.description: A grandfather clock perpetually stopped at midnight, occasionally ticking backward.

locations.name: Secret Passage
locations.description: A narrow, winding tunnel carved through solid rock, barely wide enough for a single person to traverse. The walls are damp with condensation, and ancient roots from the forest above snake through cracks in the stone ceiling. This hidden passage emerges from behind a cleverly concealed stone door in the courtyard wall, its mechanism operated by pressing a specific sequence of weathered stones. The air here is musty and close, carrying the scent of earth and decay from its connection to Gloamwood's depths. Fresh scuff marks and hastily drawn chalk symbols left by Scout Elen mark the walls and floor. Among these is an arrow pointing toward the secret stone door leading to the Outer Courtyard, a circled stone marked with an 'X,' and a trembling warning: "Shadows move on their own within--trust nothing that lacks substance."
lootTable: Scout Elen's torn cloak piece (provides scent for tracking)
Small vial of luminescent moss (acts as dim light for 1 hour)
Weathered map fragment showing other hidden entrances (partially illegible)
plotHooks: The stone door mechanism shows signs of recent use, with fresh oil applied to keep it silent.
Chalk marks on the tunnel walls appear to be Scout Elen's navigation notes, indicating she planned her route carefully.
A hastily scrawled warning reads: 'Shadows move on their own within--trust nothing that lacks substance.'
locations.dmInstructions: This passage serves as the secret connection between Gloamwood and Shadowfall Keep. The entrance from the courtyard side is hidden behind ivy and requires a DC 15 Investigation check to locate without prior knowledge. The stone door mechanism requires a DC 13 Intelligence check to operate without instructions. Players following Scout Elen's trail from Gloamwood will emerge here. The passage is too narrow for Medium creatures to fight effectively (disadvantage on melee attacks) and completely blocks Large or larger creatures. Sound echoes strangely here--loud noises might alert creatures in both the courtyard and the Hidden Keep Entrance.

doors.name: Secret Stone Door (Courtyard Side)
doors.description: A section of the courtyard wall that pivots inward when the correct stones are pressed.

doors.name: Secret Stone Door (Gloamwood Side)
doors.description: A moss-covered stone that slides aside to reveal the tunnel entrance.

dcChecks: Investigation DC 15: Locate the hidden door from the courtyard side without prior knowledge.
Intelligence DC 13: Figure out the stone door mechanism without instructions.
Survival DC 12: Follow Scout Elen's trail through the passage.
Perception DC 14: Hear sounds from either the courtyard or Gloamwood while in the tunnel.
locations.accessibility: Extremely narrow passage requiring single file movement; impassable for Large or larger creatures.

features.name: Root Network
features.description: Gnarled tree roots from Gloamwood above penetrate through cracks, creating natural handholds.

features.name: Stone Door Mechanism
features.description: An ancient but well-maintained system of counterweights and pivots that operates the secret doors.

features.name: Scout's Marks
features.description: Chalk symbols and notes left by Scout Elen to mark her path and warn of dangers ahead.

encounters.summary: The party cautiously moved through the Secret Passage, with Norn successfully performing an Investigation check (16) revealing no traps but Scout Elen's chalk marks and warnings.
encounters.impact: The party confirmed the passage was safe to proceed without triggering traps. Norn consumed a healing potion to prepare for upcoming dangers, and the warning about moving shadows hinted at potential spectral threats beyond the passage.

locations.adventureSummary: The party proceeded cautiously through the narrow and claustrophobic Secret Passage, their torchlight flickering against the damp, root-choked stone walls heavy with the scent of earth and decay. Norn conducted a successful Investigation check (16) for traps or dangers, finding none but noticing fresh scuff marks and chalk symbols left by Scout Elen. These included an arrow toward the secret door, a circled stone marked with an 'X,' and a warning about moving shadows hinting at spectral or magical threats. After ensuring the path was safe, Norn consumed a healing potion, preparing the party to advance into the Outer Courtyard.
